listitem.para: “Single-user mode”, which has a single user (typically root) who performs all package management operations. All other users can use the installed packages, but cannot perform package management operations themselves.

“Multi-user mode”, where all users can perform package management operations (e.g., installing software without root privileges). Nix ensures that this is secure: for example, it’s not possible for one user to overwrite a package used by another user with a Trojan horse.
